results.title: Birthday boy
results.creator_credit: AFTRS, Andrew Gregory and Sejong Park
results.brief_description: Korea 1951 - little Manuk is playing on the streets of his village and dreaming of life at the front where his father is a soldier. He returns home to find a parcel on the doorstep and, thinking it is a birthday present, he opens it. But its contents will change his life.

results.title: The Two-wheeled time machine
results.creator_credit: Miriam Stein, David Lowe and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
Henry Howard has discovered a way to stay young forever but life doesn’t seem worth living without his childhood sweetheart, Alice. Risking old age, Henry returns to convince her to join him.
Cast includes Matt Day as Henry, and Essie Davis as Alice (aged 19-35) and Jacki Weaver as Alice (49-76).

results.title: The Drip
results.brief_description: No matter what the doting Helmut does, his wife Gertrude is never satisfied. But things are about to change. When an ever-increasing drip starts falling from the sky onto Gertrude’s head, it’s Helmut to the rescue!

group_siblings.creator_credit: Paul Healy, Alexandra Long, Ruth Kleinhenz and AFTRS

results.title: Close to Slavery: Black Work in White History
results.brief_description: It was government policy for First Nations peoples in Australia to assimilate to the white ethics of education and work. Then came the mission stations, removal of children, forced labour often in the most deplorable conditions, exploitation and even when First Nations Australians were trained in skilled work through the mission stations, white Australians would not employ them - all this most comprehensively portrayed by the archival footage in this film.
results.title_for_label: Close to Slavery: Black Work in White History

group.title: Another day, another dollar: three short films about the history of work

group_siblings.title: Never Done: Women, Work and History
Projected Memories: Work in old films

results.title: Projected Memories: Work in old films
results.brief_description: ‘Projected memories: work in old films’. In 1947, a projectionist took a collection of instructional 16mm films about work to the bush. This short film includes excerpts from that collection covering early footage (1900s-1930s) of families on the land; factory workers; steel workers; coal miners; working women; the rise of trade-unions and the 8-hour day; peace campaign of 1938; the invention of the teleprinter; the arrival of the corner grocer shop and much more.

Never Done: Women, Work and History

results.title: Never Done: Women, Work and History
results.brief_description: ‘Never done: women, work and history’. Focuses on women in the workplace from the mid-1800s through to the 1970s including footage of the first women’s union (1882); industrialisation and factory work; the birth of the modern office worker (1890s); equal pay for equal work movement; WWI and WWII women in the workforce; trade-unionism and feminism.

results.title: Old man: returning to Lake Condah Mission

video_links.name: Old man: returning to Lake Condah Mission

results.brief_description: This is a documentary film about growing up on Lake Condah Aboriginal Mission. A local Elder, Uncle Kenny Saunders, visits the site of Lake Condah Mission and talks about his childhood memories revealing a past of cruelty and fear, and the devastation felt in the aftermath of the Eumerella massacres.
results.title_for_label: Old man: returning to Lake Condah Mission

results.title: Lygon Street
results.brief_description: Combines locational footage with personal reminiscences of Lygon St, Carlton. This film is an excerpt from ‘Stories from the hidden city’, a project conceived and directed by Bagryana Popov, 2000-2002.

results.title: End of the Line
results.brief_description: A short created by a student for the 2004 ACMI Diegesis secondary school media festival. Fleeing from town, a small child finds himself hiding in a seemingly deserted railway station. One day he is crossing the tracks when a train come hurtling towards him. A beautifully photographed film, imbued with feelings of isolation and loneliness.

results.title: Cardin Street
results.brief_description: A little piece of wood tells a whole story about a house, about home, about friendship. A personal account created by a participant in the ACMI Digital Storytelling Workshop Telling Tales. Produced in partnership with Arts Access and supported by the Department of Human Services and the Deafness Foundation for Telling Tales.
